vector types

- atomic

-- chr

-- double

-- int

-- logical

- list

all vector types must be the same or it will convert

raw vector

- hexadecimal

-- ints up to 9 then 0a == 10, 0b == 11. etc

-- 50 == 32 bc 3*16+2 = 50

na == logical

`attr` adds description to object

```{r}
x <- c("a", "b","c","d","e")
x[-c(2)]
```

```{r}
x <- c(T, NA, T, F, NA)
x[is.na(x)]
```

dont have to do return(x) can just put x alone and it will return last reference

```{r}
norm <- function(vec){
  (vec - min(vec))/range(vec)
}
```
